DOCNAME: LONGBOTTOM AND OTHERS v. THE UNITED KINGDOM
TEXT: The applicants , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON are NORP nationals who were born in DATE , DATE and DATE and live respectively in GPE , GPE and GPE . They were represented before ORG by PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , PERSON , of ORG
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

The applicant ’s wife died on DATE , leaving CARDINAL children born in DATE and DATE . His claim for widows’ benefits was made in or DATE and was rejected on DATE on the ground that he was not entitled to widows’ benefits because he was not a woman . The applicant applied again on DATE and his claim was rejected on DATE for the same reason . The applicant lodged an appeal on CARDINAL DATE . ORG reconsideration decision of DATE upheld the earlier decision and his appeal was further heard and adjourned by a tribunal on DATE . The applicant did not appeal further as he considered or was advised that such a remedy would be bound to fail since no such social security benefits were payable to widowers under GPE law .
